name: Bank Policy Institute
goal: The Bank Policy Institute is a nonpartisan public policy, research and advocacy group, representing the nation’s leading banks and their customers.  Our members include universal banks, regional banks and the major foreign banks doing business in the United States.  Collectively, they employ almost 2 million Americans, make nearly half of the nation’s small business loans, and are an engine for financial innovation and economic growth.
interests: Banking and financial services, Competition, Consumers, Digital economy and society, Economy, finance and the euro, Fraud prevention, Justice and Fundamental Rights, Research and innovation, Single market, Taxation, Trade
euInitiatives: Capital/liquidity, recovery/resolution, bank activities and structure, privacy and data security, bank supervision, anti-money laundering, risk management and bank governance.
